fine_dining.name: Restaurant Lieffroy
fine_dining.atmosphere: Elegant and intimate in a historic building
fine_dining.booking_tips: Book 1-2 months in advance, especially for weekend dining
fine_dining.local_tips: One of Odense's most highly regarded restaurants; excellent wine selection; seasonal menu changes regularly based on available local ingredients

fine_dining.name: Restaurant Aro
signature_dishes: Local Funen produce with innovative preparations
fine_dining.atmosphere: Modern and sophisticated with Danish design elements
fine_dining.booking_tips: Reserve 2-3 weeks in advance, closed Sundays and Mondays
fine_dining.local_tips: Focus on local Funen ingredients; creative presentation; opt for the wine pairing for the full experience; excellent vegetarian options available

fine_dining.name: Restaurant Kvægtorvet
fine_dining.atmosphere: Sophisticated industrial in former cattle market building
fine_dining.booking_tips: Book 2-3 weeks in advance, request window seating
fine_dining.local_tips: Known for excellent steaks and seafood; housed in a beautifully renovated historic building; good cocktail menu; popular with local business diners

casual_dining.name: Storms Pakhus
signature_dishes: International street food from various vendors
casual_dining.atmosphere: Vibrant industrial market in former warehouse
casual_dining.booking_tips: No reservations needed, but arrive outside peak hours to find seating
casual_dining.local_tips: Over 20 food stalls offering diverse cuisines; popular with locals; great for groups with different food preferences; lively weekend atmosphere with occasional live music

casual_dining.name: Café Gertrud
casual_dining.atmosphere: Cozy and hygge with vintage Danish furnishings
casual_dining.booking_tips: Reservations recommended for lunch, especially on weekends
casual_dining.local_tips: Authentic Danish lunch experience; excellent smørrebrød; charming atmosphere in historic building; popular with locals for casual business lunches

casual_dining.name: Pasfall
casual_dining.atmosphere: Bright and contemporary with Danish design
casual_dining.local_tips: Quality Danish cuisine at more accessible prices than fine dining; excellent lunch deal on weekdays; good wine list focusing on European selections

casual_dining.name: Nordatlanten
casual_dining.atmosphere: Maritime theme with North Atlantic artwork
casual_dining.booking_tips: Walk-ins usually accommodated but reservations recommended for dinner
casual_dining.local_tips: Located in the North Atlantic House cultural center; unique opportunity to taste authentic cuisine from Greenland, Iceland, and Faroe Islands; cultural events often hosted in the same building

street_food.name: Arkaden Food Market
street_food.local_tips: Smaller than Storms Pakhus but centrally located; good mix of international and Danish options; popular lunch spot for locals working downtown

street_food.name: HC Andersen Bageri
street_food.local_tips: Iconic bakery in Odense; try the 'Andersen's hat' pastry; excellent morning stop while exploring the historic quarter; popular with both locals and tourists

street_food.name: Odense Harbour Pølsevogn
street_food.local_tips: Authentic Danish hot dog stand experience; where locals go for quick harbor-side meals; try the 'ristet hotdog med det hele' (toasted hot dog with everything)

coffee_shops.name: Nelle's Coffee & Wine
coffee_shops.atmosphere: Elegant yet cozy with outdoor courtyard
coffee_shops.local_tips: One of Odense's best coffee spots; transforms into a wine bar in evenings; beautiful hidden courtyard seating in summer

coffee_shops.name: Tinderbox
coffee_shops.local_tips: Named after Hans Christian Andersen's famous tale; excellent coffee beans for purchase; popular with university students and creative professionals

coffee_shops.name: Café Fleuri
coffee_shops.atmosphere: Classic Danish café with hygge elements
coffee_shops.food_options: Traditional Danish open-faced sandwiches and cakes
coffee_shops.local_tips: Authentic Danish café experience; favorite among older locals; excellent place to experience 'hygge' culture; famous for generous cake portions

bars.name: Christian Firtal
bars.atmosphere: Relaxed beer café with outdoor seating
bars.local_tips: Named after King Christian IV; over 15 taps plus extensive bottle selection; knowledgeable staff offering recommendations; popular with beer enthusiasts

bars.name: Anarkist Beer & Food Lab
bars.atmosphere: Industrial brewery space with open kitchen
bars.local_tips: Innovative brewery concept from Odense's Albani brewery; experimental beers not available elsewhere; excellent food pairings; brewery tours available on weekends

bars.name: Blomsten & Bien
bars.local_tips: Odense's premier cocktail destination; hidden entrance adds to charm; mixologists create custom drinks based on preferences; reservations recommended on weekends

bars.name: Ølbaren
bars.atmosphere: Authentic Danish brown bar with cozy nooks
bars.local_tips: Authentic Danish pub experience; where locals gather; reasonable prices; occasional live jazz; historic venue with authentic atmosphere

food_tours.name: Taste of Odense Tour
food_tours.booking_tips: Book at least a week in advance; tour includes substantial walking through historic areas

food_tours.name: Culinary Funen Experience
food_tours.booking_tips: Book 2 weeks ahead; includes transportation to local producers outside city center

food_tours.name: Brewery Heritage Tour
food_tours.booking_tips: Book 1-2 weeks ahead; includes substantial beer tastings; eat before the tour

cooking_classes.name: Funen Culinary School
includes: All ingredients, recipes, full meal with beer or wine pairing
cooking_classes.booking_tips: Reserve 1-2 weeks ahead; classes held twice weekly

cooking_classes.name: Hans Christian Andersen's Table
what_you_learn: Dishes from Hans Christian Andersen's era
includes: Premium ingredients, historic recipes, multi-course meal with wine pairing, storytelling session
cooking_classes.booking_tips: Book 3 weeks ahead; unique cultural and culinary experience; held in historic building

markets.name: Odense Marcipan Factory Store
markets.hours: Monday to Friday 10 AM - 5:30 PM, Saturday 10 AM - 2 PM
markets.local_tips: Home of world-famous Odense Marcipan; watch demonstration of marzipan craft; special seasonal creations; perfect for edible souvenirs

markets.name: Odense Farmers Market
markets.local_tips: Odense's traditional produce market; where locals shop for fresh ingredients; excellent for picnic supplies; most vibrant on Saturday mornings

markets.name: Storms Pakhus
markets.hours: Monday to Thursday 11 AM - 8 PM, Friday to Saturday 11 AM - 10 PM, Sunday 11 AM - 7 PM
markets.local_tips: Vibrant warehouse conversion; diverse food options; popular with locals and students; good evening atmosphere with occasional live music and events

spring: Nye kartofler med smør (new potatoes with butter and dill)
Ramsløg (wild garlic) featured in seasonal dishes
summer: Fynsk rygeost (Funen smoked fresh cheese) with radishes
autumn: Fynsk æblekage (Funen apple cake) with apples from local orchards
winter: Gløgg (mulled wine) and æbleskiver (traditional spherical pancakes)
